Text:
During the pandemic, U.S. billionaires have seen their wealth increase by nearly $2 trillion.

Our Build Back Better Agenda will cut costs for working people by ensuring the ultra-wealthy pay their fair share.
Our Build Back Better Agenda will cut taxes for the middle class, lower costs for working families, create jobs, and sustain economic growth for years to come.

The ultra-wealthy and corporations don’t need another tax cut.

You know who does? The middle class.

As we rebuild from this crisis, we have an incredible opportunity to invest in and strengthen the middle class—leading us into the second half of the 21st century with a stronger, more equitable America.

The United States joins the call for a new financial intermediary fund at the World Bank, which will help us bring together new resources for pandemic preparedness. I am proud to announce that we are prepared to contribute at least $250M to help get this fund started.

We need to act so that our world will be ready to respond before and not after the next pandemic emerges. This pandemic caught us off guard—and it should not have. 

We have learned the cost of failing to prepare. https://t.co/B8vNNk00RW

For the first time in 20 years, the United States is not at war. 

@JoeBiden is turning the page to focus on the challenges ahead of us. https://t.co/GKqWfSPCBa

Instead of continuing to fight the wars of the past, we must answer the challenges of our collective future. America will lead the world to a more peaceful and prosperous future for all of us. https://t.co/S3D1SH31UD

Our Build Back Better Agenda is built on the belief that a strong economy depends on a solid foundation of public investment—and that today’s investments in workers, families, and communities will pay dividends for generations to come.

For decades, Republicans have fought to cut taxes for the ultra-wealthy, all while underinvesting in public goods like infrastructure and innovation.

Our Build Back Better Agenda will lower costs for middle-class families. When the middle class does better, everyone does better.

So-called “trickle-down” economics never worked for working families. 

Our Build Back Better Agenda will invest in the middle class and have the ultra-wealthy and corporations pay their fair share.

If big corporations and the very wealthy pay their fair share, we can invest in the American people, cut taxes for the middle class, reduce health care costs, create jobs, fight climate change, and so much more. https://t.co/4U1XeNqe2V
Our Build Back Better Agenda will lower costs for middle-class families and create millions of good-paying jobs rebuilding our country's infrastructure.
Our Build Back Better Agenda will add hearing, dental, and vision benefits to Medicare.

Four years ago, Republicans passed $2T in tax cuts for the largest corporations and ultra-wealthy.

Now, @JoeBiden plans to cut taxes for the middle class and invest in our country’s future by making corporations and the ultra-wealthy pay their fair share. The choice is clear.

Our Build Back Better Agenda will cut taxes for the middle class, invest in our future, and tackle climate change head-on. 

We’ll pay for it by making the largest corporations and the very wealthy pay their fair share.
It’s time for our economy to work for all working people. That starts with making big corporations and the very wealthy pay their fair share. https://t.co/m194SZCfCD

Climate change is an existential threat to our way of life. Every year we wait to take action, extreme weather and disruption make life harder for millions of Americans. 

Our Build Back Better Agenda will tackle the climate crisis head on.

Millions of women have dropped out of the workforce during the pandemic. It’s a national emergency. 

We need to invest in quality, affordable child care to help get working mothers back to work and set our economy up for sustainable, long-term growth.

High-quality, affordable child care is fundamental to our modern economy. 

Today, with Secretary Yellen we are calling on Congress to invest in working families and make sure parents have the peace of mind that when they’re at work, their children are in good care.

Congratulations to my friend, Governor @GavinNewsom. In resoundingly rejecting this recall attempt, California voters made it clear that the people want leaders who stand for women’s rights, voting rights, and workers’ rights.

Governor @GavinNewsom is a leader who always speaks the truth on behalf of all people. He fights for working people, organized labor, women, and Dreamers. So much is at stake in the California recall election. Vote NO on the recall to keep him in office. https://t.co/cHDr3W48o4

Gov. @GavinNewsom is fighting for Californians, and his vision will keep not only the state, but also our nation moving forward. California voters, we know so much is at stake and there is so much good we can do. Get out and vote NO on the recall election. Polls close at 8pm.

Gov. @GavinNewsom is a national leader on one of the great threats to our democracy right now: the blatant attacks on voting rights. 

We will not give up. Let’s vote NO on the California recall by mail or in-person by September 14. https://t.co/tR2LlND7nl
By vaccinating the unvaccinated, increasing our testing and masking, and protecting the vaccinated, we can end this pandemic. That’s exactly what we are committed to doing.

Gov. @GavinNewsom fights for working people. He is a governor for workers’ rights, labor unions, farm workers and Dreamers—and he’s always stood for reproductive rights. This election is about the values we hold dear. Vote NO on the CA recall by mail or in-person by September 14.

On the 20th anniversary of 9/11, we honor the lives lost and the first responders who ran towards danger to save others during the worst terrorist attack on America in our history. They remind us that the strength of the human spirit knows no bounds.

What’s happening in Texas, in Georgia, and across our country with policies attacking women’s rights, reproductive rights, voting rights, worker rights—Republicans think if they can win in California, they can do this anywhere. 

We won’t let them win.

As an alumna of an HBCU, I am proud to celebrate HBCU Week. HBCUs have empowered and challenged students for generations, offering incredible opportunities to our future innovators and creating an important legacy of leadership in our country. https://t.co/Vobg1Fcujb

We want leaders in California to have a vision of what is possible and to inspire and uplift all people. 

@GavinNewsom understands the dignity of all people. We must vote NO on the CA recall by mail or in-person by September 14 so that he can continue to lead the state forward. https://t.co/pz48nUP9bT
.@JoeBiden is doing what is necessary to end the pandemic. https://t.co/MFGCw5nHL8

California, this election is not a one-off. This is about who we are as a nation. 

We need everyone to vote NO by mail, or in-person by September 14 so Governor @GavinNewsom can continue leading California—so much is at stake. https://t.co/ilBTD922ZP

Republicans think if they can win in California, they can push policies everywhere to attack women's rights, reproductive rights, voting rights, and workers’ rights.

We will show them they’re not going to get this done. Not here. Never. https://t.co/z6KnFcitYK

Campaigning with Gov. @GavinNewsom today—a leader who has guided California through unprecedented crises and is a key partner to building our economy back better than before. Let’s keep him on the job.
https://t.co/YE6jJB6W5k

California, voting is underway! Let’s keep @GavinNewsom fighting for Californians in Sacramento and keep the state and nation moving forward.

Vote NO on the recall. Sign your envelope and return your mail-in ballot or vote in person by September 14. https://t.co/KAZPt1vzJ1
This Labor Day, we honor the work the labor movement has done to fight for better wages, safer working conditions, and sick days. When unions are strong, America is strong. https://t.co/NxLOgXBEAR

Last night, the Supreme Court’s decision on Texas’ SB8 dealt a significant blow to Roe v. Wade.

We will not stand by and allow our nation to go back to the days of back-alley abortions. We will use every lever to defend the right to safe and legal abortion. We will fight this.

Human rights will be the center of our foreign policy. 

The way to do that is not through endless military deployments, but through diplomacy, economic tools, and rallying the rest of the world for support.

Texas law SB8 blatantly violates the constitutional right established under Roe v. Wade nearly five decades ago. It will disproportionately affect communities of color and individuals with low incomes from getting access to the health care they need. 

We must protect that right.
As @JoeBiden said yesterday, there is nothing low-grade, low-risk, or low-cost about any war. It was time to end the war in Afghanistan. https://t.co/eIRNQdiqT9

Now that the House has passed John Lewis’ namesake legislation, the Senate must pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act, making it the law of the land and protecting voters across the country.

.@JoeBiden made a commitment to the American people when he ran for president that he would bring America’s military involvement in Afghanistan to an end.

It’s the right decision.
We are working around the clock to evacuate Americans and Afghan allies—including translators, interpreters, Afghan women leaders, and journalists.

When we connect Americans to affordable and accessible internet, we're connecting:
→Children to education.
→Seniors to telemedicine.
→Families to each other.
→Americans to economic opportunity.

In the 21st century, broadband is a critical infrastructure.
The Bipartisan Infrastructure Deal will generate millions of jobs, modernize our transportation infrastructure, and create a more sustainable future for our children.

To date, we’ve created more jobs than any other administration has in its first six months. While there’s more work to be done, we are making tremendous strides to build our country back better than before. https://t.co/i6Yp7xlSY6

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Plan and our Build Back Better Agenda are not just about fixing what has been. 

It’s about building what can be.

2.5 million people have signed up for health insurance through the Affordable Care Act during the special enrollment period一there’s still time to join them: https://t.co/zmKsbKOrYE. https://t.co/GlALR6fdZv
The right to vote is not a “Democratic” or “Republican” issue—it’s an American issue. https://t.co/xuLCQtpqva
Together, we’ve brought this economy back. We are building a foundation for an economy that brings everyone along, not just the top 1%.
Get vaccinated for the people you love.
The brave officers who risked their lives to save others sacrificed so much to defend our nation. In securing our Capitol, they secured our democracy. They are heroes. https://t.co/yJjTAg4QMh

The U.S. economy is projected to experience the highest economic growth rate in nearly 40 years. 

We’re building America back better than before.

The right to vote is the right that unlocks all other rights. When we cast a ballot, we decide our leaders. When we cast a ballot, we determine our future.

Congress must pass the For the People Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act to protect our sacred right.

The expanded Child Tax Credit is the largest middle-class tax cut in generations, and it will cut child poverty in half in America.

Congress should extend these tax cuts for years to come.

Today, poll taxes have been traded for long voting lines. Literacy tests for bans on drive-thru voting. 

Mail-in voting limitations. Gerrymandering. It's all voter suppression by any other name—we must pass legislation to protect voting rights.

Virginia Democrats are fired up and ready to continue creating good-paying jobs and ensure every child has a world-class education. Tune in for a grassroots event with @JoeBiden and @TerryMcAuliffe. 

https://t.co/ba7pmRZIqr

Every day, Americans drive over roads and bridges that are in need of repair. People commute on transit systems that are outdated. Americans have water coming out of their tap that isn't clean and use internet that isn’t high speed.

Our Build Back Better Agenda will change this.
Now is the time to roll up your sleeves and get the COVID-19 shot.
Help is here for millions of families all over our country. It’s a good day, America. https://t.co/vrXLOlsYRN
We believe tackling climate change, improving communities, and creating jobs can occur simultaneously. We can do this and more with the Build Back Better Agenda.
The Bipartisan Infrastructure Framework would be the largest long-term investment in our infrastructure and competitiveness in nearly a century in our country.
.@TexasDemocrats, you are fighters. https://t.co/zRUpYaiLqN
The Delta variant is on the rise. Get vaccinated.
.@TheDemocrats are expanding the I Will Vote initiative with a $25 million investment to protect and expand voting rights—and we need you to join us in this fight. https://t.co/SfM7JC8BNL

.@TheDemocrats are taking the fight to protect and expand the right to vote directly to the states—holding Republican lawmakers accountable and helping to turn out voters. Chip in now to ensure they have the resources to defend the right to vote. 
https://t.co/XbyxcwNi1Y

Help @TheDemocrats fight back against Republican efforts to take away your right to vote and ensure that we can safeguard our democracy. Sign up to volunteer today. 
https://t.co/IpT2q9HqXn

Our democracy is stronger when everyone participates.

The DNC is deploying every asset available to ensure every eligible American can access their right to vote, focusing on voter education, registration, turnout, and protection.
Your vote is your power—and you must not let anybody ever take your power from you. https://t.co/xYGUlt5khb

The right to vote is not partisan—it’s not Democratic or Republican. The right to vote is an American right. Join us in this fight by chipping in to support our critical work. 
https://t.co/G4TDHhv1Yf
Our democracy is strongest when everyone participates. https://t.co/PM6bMb19lA

.@TheDemocrats are making a $25 million investment to protect and expand voting rights. This is the fight of our lifetime. 

Your voice matters. Your vote matters. https://t.co/pdykb0H4GB
Proud to announce @TheDemocrats are launching a first-of-its-kind, party-wide effort to fight to protect the fundamental right to vote. Watch live. https://t.co/Wo5I5p8krw
This Fourth of July, America is coming back. https://t.co/BqoUElfTMZ

Thanks to @JoeBiden’s leadership, we’ve gotten the pandemic under control and put our economy back on track. Now, Americans across our country are coming together to celebrate our independence and honor those who have and currently serve.

Let’s achieve our independence from this virus. 

Get vaccinated.

The right to vote is fundamental. It gives Americans a voice in what happens in our nation. When more people have a voice, our democracy becomes more representative, and our nation becomes stronger. 

We won’t give up the fight to strengthen our right to vote.

The DNC is essential in making sure we elect Democrats nationwide who are committed to building our country back—and they’re facing a big fundraising deadline tonight. Please consider chipping in to @TheDemocrats before its end-of-quarter deadline. 
https://t.co/aatrUfTQRn

It was an honor to marry Sandy Stier and Kris Perry after the courts lifted California’s ban on marriage equality in 2013. Two years later, for the first time in our history, every American had the right to marry the person they love. https://t.co/TZqOlXtii6

As more Americans get their COVID-19 vaccine, fewer people are dying from this virus. We need your help to ensure as many people as possible receive their COVID-19 vaccine. Sign up to take action and spread the word today. 
https://t.co/nUrSXGU5PF

The United States has experienced more deaths from COVID-19 than from World War I, World War II, the Vietnam War, and 9/11 combined. 

We can stop this pandemic. Get vaccinated.
Like generations before, we will not give up, we will not give in, and we will continue the fight to strengthen the right to vote. https://t.co/y6LGlDkKgu
Vaccines are safe, they are free, and they are effective. It’s that simple.
Our future leaders inspire me every day. https://t.co/GdXTWlK4jt
Throughout our nation’s history, many have fought—and even died—to ensure that all eligible Americans can have their vote counted. Today, that hard-won progress is under assault.
Today is a day of celebration and pride. We reaffirm and rededicate ourselves to ensuring freedom and justice for all. Happy Juneteenth! https://t.co/3KeZDBq8A4
The Affordable Care Act is here to stay. Make sure to tell your friends and family that they can still sign up for health care at https://t.co/5fdKPdDoDB.

Nearly 2 million women have been forced out of the workforce since the pandemic began, and the lack of accessible, affordable child care is often the reason why.

The American Families Plan will establish universal Pre-K and lower the cost of child care. https://t.co/h4FHAS3fPz
Reminder: Uber and Lyft are giving FREE rides for passengers going to get their FREE COVID-19 vaccine until July 4.

More than 30M Americans live in areas without reliable broadband. The American Jobs Plan would connect every household.

As we connect America, we'll create good-paying jobs. We'll help our students succeed. We'll help our small businesses. And we'll help our nation compete.

We’re counting on you to roll up your sleeves and get vaccinated. Do it for yourself, for your family, for your community, and for your country. Visit https://t.co/sohfL3zr12 or text your ZIP code to 438829 to find a FREE COVID-19 vaccine near you.
Our democracy is strongest when everyone participates. We should be fighting to make it easier for every eligible voter to cast a ballot, not harder.

Child care shouldn’t be a barrier to getting your FREE COVID-19 vaccine. Four of the nation’s largest child care providers are offering free care to all parents and caregivers getting their shot from now until July 4. Learn more: https://t.co/GLspQvmbCY

Young Americans ages 12 and up can now get the COVID-19 vaccine. The vaccine is safe, effective, and will help protect kids and the community against the spread of the virus. Visit https://t.co/sohfL3zr12 for more information.

Our nation must reimagine our economy so we can come out of this pandemic stronger than before.
https://t.co/rGMW9zf06l
It’s free to get a COVID-19 vaccine. Roll up your sleeve and get your shot today.

We’re kicking off a National Month of Action to mobilize an all-of-America sprint to get 70% of U.S. adults at least one shot by July 4. Visit https://t.co/m7VjPcsijl to get involved and help us reach our goal.

Every June, we celebrate the contributions the LGBTQ+ community have made to our nation’s past, present, and future—but we must recommit ourselves to protecting the community from discrimination and harm and delivering full and equal rights to LGBTQ+ Americans.

As soon as we were sworn in, we got to work to get America back on track—but we still have work to do. If you can, consider pitching in to @TheDemocrats to help elect leaders who are ready to make the progress this moment demands. 
https://t.co/RGDeKJP60B
People uniting against hate can strengthen our country. https://t.co/V9EPPo0cPh
